item.title: Chaos Engineering using Docker Compose
item.description: Chaos engineering using Docker compose By Richard Rostad [[Chaos Engineering]] is a form of Testing It’s ok to test things that are already in production if you don’t have the time to wait for the tests.

item.title: Defects dont kill you, they make you stronger
item.description: We should document all defects and try to cover them wih automated tests when possible. It will grow the coverage and help build a stronger application.

item.title: Eurostar 2022 Copenhagen Denmark seen by me, Manu
item.description: [[people/Manu/Emmanuel]] Eurostar 2022 Copenhagen Denmark seen by me, Manu EuroSTAR stands for European Software Testing Analysis & Review. Hi !,

item.title: keynote - drawing lines around the fog
item.description: Keynote : Drawing lines around the fog by Alexandra Schladebeck or 7 Things I might be wrong about Predictions Quality will become even more important, and we’ll screw it up Exemples of current quality challenges :

item.title: Keynote : My Essence of Testing - Understanding Relations
item.description: Keynote : My Essence of Testing - Understanding Relations My essence of Testing by Richard Edgreen Testing starts in your head, it’s dependant of your understanding of the problem the application is trying to solve.

item.title: Keynote Michael Bolton - Lost in transformation - Renaud
item.description: Keynote : Lost in transformation by Michael Bolton Digital transformation Most applications aren’t designed for the cases where everithing is not going as planed.

item.title: Remote Ensemble Testing - From Experiment to Common Practice - Andrea Jensen
item.description: notes by [[people/Jana]] Official introduction The Experiment A remote ensemble testing session with the a whole cross-functional team (voluntarily)

item.title: Take Charge! Unbend yourself back into action - Brijesh Deb
item.description: Notes by [[people/Jana]] Official introduction Mental healt issues have a lot of consequences, both on an individual level as at an organisational/society level.

item.title: Thanks, I hate It: Being grateful for failure - Dylan Lacey
item.description: Notes by [[people/Jana]] Official introduction Failure? Failure is … inevitable: it’s the first step in doing anything complex. valuable: it teaches you something about the system under your control.

item.title: The 7Ps Rule; Proper Planning & Preparation Prevents P... Performance - Søren Wassard
item.description: Notes by [[people/Jana]] Official introduction Problems 14 common reasons software projects fail (according to Forbes): not understanding the needs of the business lack of clarity and execution strategy not starting with end customer thinking that scaope can be defined upfront lack of coordination and detailed planning The cost of fixing an issue goes up with time (from initiation phase to building phase to production) => the sooner you find it, the better.

item.title: Tutorial B
item.description: Notes by [[people/Jana]] Speaker: Andrew Brown Official introduction Confirmation Bias Often when we test we start from a hypothesis (our belief in how the system is/should work) and we’re only looking for confirmation: we run tests that confirm the hypothesis instead of challenging it.

item.title: Tutorial A
item.description: Notes by Virginie Official introduction [[shaping testing]] – A Simulation in Scrum get experience with splitting stories and epics together with the team (backlog refinement session) : try to create smaller stories get experience with raising risks (probabiblity x impact) with the team (backlog refinement session) perform estimates with the team as a whole (backlog refinement session) collaborating on the test approach within the team: defining tests levels together with the whole team Identify & plan the tasks (inclusive testing tasks) during sprint planning for the stories of the sprint : per story level : lists things to be done (not by whom - help will be provide where needed) How to avoid shift to next sprint : try to create smaller stories + test design asap in the process

item.title: Tutorial F - From Business Workflows to Automated Tests
item.description: Tutorail By Dr Anne Kramer, using Yest (Yest has a jira integration) Introduction We want to Atomalte Tests, but it is difficult.

item.title: Tutorial I - Simplicity: Distilling and Refining Test Communication
item.description: Simplicity: Distilling and Refining Test Communication Simplification It doesn’t need to just look simpler but to actually be simpler. There is value in simplicity :

item.title: What's your Test Design Debt ? Avoid the inevitable!
item.description: What’s your Test Design Debt ? Avoid the inevitable! by Wim Decoutere Requirements WILL CHANGE business processes change Cometitors innovate Legislation regulation Business change priorities New technologies Users ask new features Defects may induce changes to be fixed When faced with a change, we can accept, reject or postpone it.
